result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric James Meyers

11:00 AM Defendant Eric James Meyers in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Eric James Meyers.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests another status conference. Court sets status conference.

11:13 AM Defendant Eric James Meyers in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Eric James Meyers.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. State has no objection.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim 1 or her residence

2:05 PM Defendant Eric James Meyers appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Hoffman.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State requesting 1500cb, no contact with victim 1 or address as listed on ID Key. No contact with EBM except in court for domestic matters.
State reviews criminal history and ftas (2). MN and WI. Previous probation.
Attorney makes argument; local resident, children that reside in area. No ability to post. 
Defendant indicates he might be able to post 500cb
Court orders 500cb and 2000sb No contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in ID Key.  
Court questions State on no contact request with EMB.
State indicates material witness fears retaliation. 
Attorney requests Court deny request for no contact with witness.
Court denies request for no contact with witness.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:45 am.
